intro: Paraspalathus lotoides, commonly known as the small-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in grasslands and open woodlands, thriving in well-drained soils. It features small, ovate leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-green flowers. Its structure and growth habits make it an important component of its native ecosystems.
